creator: Syretia
text:
There are several different app bundlers available for Linux, such as Snaps, Flatpaks, and AppImages. Each of these creates an executable that includes its own libraries. ## Snaps - Sandbox applications. - Update automatically without user interaction, which can unfortunately cause breakage with no clear indicators. ## Flatpaks - Don't follow system themes, you must have a flatpak installed for the theme. - The flatpak package manager has also been known to have issues with dependencies. ## AppImages - Not sandboxed, but are completely self-contained. - Each AppImage can update itself (but won't do so without telling the user). - This means that AppImages don't require a package manager or additional software, making them completely portable. Because of these comparative features, if you need to use a bundled application we recommend using AppImages if possible.
*This entry is outdated and needs updating. Perhaps remove this entry and create an entry for Flatpaks.*
